title: Smoking Habits | 2 of 2
question_text: Last week, a random sample of size $300$ found that $31\%$ of people smoke cigarettes on a weekly basis. This compares to $35\%$ nationally. Suppose the sample was increased to $3{,}000$ people. To be as unlikely as the $31\%$ sample proportion found for a sample of size $n=300$ , how much below the population proportion of $35\%$ must the sample of $n=3{,}000$ be?
